title: Default value prop is reset all the time
body:
**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?** report a bug **What is the current behavior?** I have a prop in my component that has a default value. The prop seems to change at every render. To test this, I created this example [on codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/s/nostalgic-booth-fbewe), and clicked on the button. Everytime I click, margins is updated. ````tsx import { useWhyDidYouRender } from "hooks"; import React, { useState } from "react"; const MySubComponent = ({ width, margins = { top: 1, bottom: 2 }, }: { width: number; margins?: { top: number; bottom: number }; }) => { const [counter, setCounter] = useState(0); useWhyDidYouRender("MySubComponent", { width, margins, counter }); return (
marginTop: {margins.top} marginBottom: {margins.bottom}
); }; const MyComponent = () => { return (
); }; export default MyComponent; ```` console: ````console [why-did-you-render] MySubComponent {margins: {…}} margins: from: {top: 1, bottom: 2} to: {top: 1, bottom: 2} useWhyDidYouRender.ts:44 [why-did-you-render] MySubComponent {margins: {…}} useWhyDidYouRender.ts:44 [why-did-you-render] MySubComponent {margins: {…}} ```` **If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem. Your bug will get fixed much faster if we can run your code and it doesn't have dependencies other than React. Paste the link to your JSFiddle (https://jsfiddle.net/Luktwrdm/) or CodeSandbox (https://codesandbox.io/s/new) example below:** https://codesandbox.io/s/nostalgic-booth-fbewe **What is the expected behavior?** prop with default value should not be reset at every unrelated change **Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?** React: 16.8.4 OS: Windows 10 browser: Chrome
